subtitle: Hi and welcome back to Astral Doorway! So many of you liked the Lucid Dreaming vs Astral Projection video
and Mark D even had an experience from it which you can see on the screen
this is what i mean when i say through understanding alone we can begin to have deeper experiences because we
contemplated and exercised our intuition deep enough that it had an impact on our subconscious
so in the Lucid Dreaming vs Astral Projection video you'll notice that i basically said i
deliberately avoided getting into the subject of unconscious dreams that can happen in
objective realities, i avoided getting into that for the purpose of saving confusion keeping things
simple and also for the practical purposes of attaining astral projection experiences
i said that it's better to just write off all unconscious dreams if you're not lucid
or aware as just dreams because after all we're here to experience fully conscious out
of body experiences with our waking awareness intact just like we have in our physical life
that's why we're here right? to achieve this, if you didn't watch that video i recommend listening
to that first before this one if you like a link to that is on the screen now. so in this
video let's now explore the fact that some dreams are actually unconscious astral projections,
we're going to look into the complexity of non-physical phenomena and go beyond our usual understanding of
lucid dreaming and astral projection and how they can mix up in our experiences
so some dreams can be unconscious astral projections, for example when sometimes people
are visited by relatives who have passed away and they wake up remembering them as only dreams but
in reality there was some objectivity to it, also there are many accounts of friends waking up and
having the same dream, or you could also have just remembered any sort of unconscious astral
projection such as being in an astral classroom like one of the experiences i shared last week
so yes, dreams can sometimes be objective reality but when it comes to practice it can be difficult
to differentiate these experiences, you only gain a better sense of identifying your experiences
accurately after a good amount of practice, everyone's dream worlds are different
and unique after all, now on the opposite side of shared dreams non-shared astral projections
are also possible, astral projections that are in an individual reality
or an internal reality you could say, these aren't as common but they can happen
for example perhaps you're visiting a possible future reality or visiting past events of earth
or perhaps seeing your past lives, seeing your past lives is a very individual experience, you
don't have anyone else with you because it's a sort of remembering in the astral plane
for me i've had very intimate and individual experiences of being within certain energy centers
or chakras you could say that i felt were in a deep and profound part of myself; it was inside my own
microcosm you could say, i've also had experiences where i went into voids
i was you know fully conscious it was the astral plane and i started to see fractals
these could be related to the mental plane, planes which exist beyond the astral plane
but perhaps you know i will share all of that in the future
so in the Lucid Dreaming vs Astral Projection video i showed you this diagram, now
this is actually a basic version of the diagram for practical purposes of understanding how
awareness can grow or expand to achieve astral projection, however the topic of
this video is to talk more broadly about the astral plane and shared dreams so take a look
at the original diagram on the screen now, see how the consensus and individual realities span
across all three states of awareness unconscious dreams, lucid dreams, and astral projection
individual reality means an experience where only you are in the environment, whereas consensus
reality is typically an environment which you can share with others, so as mentioned in that of the
video this diagram was created by someone called Vanquish in the astral projection subreddit and
the astral lounge discord, so if you just take a look on the screen this is what vanquish explains
"traditionally we would call all dreams individual experiences however in the realm of astral
projection discussions dreams are often associated with experiences of low or lower lucidity
awareness and the truth is many of these experiences are not
individual realities it is also possible to have individual experiences of astral projection"
here's also another version of the diagram with more basic terminology just to make
it a bit simpler if you're struggling to conceptualize, now let's go even deeper and
consider another possibility that i think is true, now i understand this won't be as readily
understood or accepted by most so please keep in mind this is just my own theory
it's the fact that we can be in a dream and astral projection at the same time
too much info to handle? well i have my reasons to believe this from experience and speculation
you see, take me for example who has had many astral projections i can have experiences which
are extremely real and tangible more real than physical waking life and i feel like my
awareness on the diagram is at a mind-expanding transcendental 100 percent right? however in the
ultimate scheme of consciousness i'm really only at a very small percentage of being awakened, why?
well because i'm not some enlightened being who knows all the answers of the universe right? i'm
not buddha or jesus i'm just a regular person like you or anyone else i know i'm not that enlightened
and don't have all the answers, anyone who says that they have reached ultimate enlightenment
and thinks they have fully awakened and that there's no room for more expansion is sincerely
and utterly wrong, frankly, don't believe anyone who says that they have reached enlightenment, anyone
who has truly awakened and enlightened would never say that because they understand. you know
our consciousness as individuals and as a species will continue to grow in this life and beyond, when
you think you've reached enlightenment there's always a bigger mountain ahead and i'm reminded
of a quote from Helena Blavatsky that i think sums this up well which you can see on the screen
she says, "whatever plane our consciousness may be acting in both we and the things belonging
to that plane are, for the time being our only realities as we rise in the scale of development
we perceive that during the stages through which we have passed we mistook shadows for realities
and the upward progress of the ego is a series of progressive awakenings each advance bringing with
it the idea that now at last we have reached reality but only when we shall have reached
absolute consciousness and blended our own with it, shall we be free from delusions produced
by maya", maya meaning illusions i'll leave a link in the description for the meaning behind maya if
you're interested, and what she meant by absolute consciousness is what i mean by the fact that we
as general beings no matter how awakened or enlightened we are are usually only a few percent
conscious in the ultimate scheme of our whole consciousness, you know, absolute consciousness
would be a true 100% i was also part of a Gnostic group who taught that most of humanity
on average are only three percent conscious and 97% unconscious
and that those who are perhaps very awakened are around 10% conscious, but even that would be
a generous measure, this is pretty much in line with my own belief you know just remember i'm only
expressing my own belief and speculation you don't need to agree with it or believe it i'm simply
just presenting you the idea so that i can set some ground for how dreams and astral projection
can happen at the same time, it will all link, you know you'll also find scientific studies stating
that we only use a small percentage of our brains and also psychological studies stating that only
a small part of our psyche is conscious, so with this idea that overall as beings of consciousness
we are only a tiny bit awakened, take a look at this diagram which is a more general indication
of how most of us are, and that even if we are in astral projection that 3% probably
only goes up to maybe 4, 5, 6 or 7% no matter how profound the experience is
it's my understanding that if you were a truly 100% conscious being, a 100% self-realized being there
wouldn't be a thing you didn't know, you would know every thought and feeling of everyone you met
you'd know every event before it happened, you'd be able to answer some of the biggest mysteries
in spirituality and science and solve many things and much more, this is the power of
consciousness, our untapped potential, and so with this understanding you may now start to understand
where i'm coming from when i say that dreams and astral projection could happen at the same
time because a large part of ourselves is still dormant, subjective, unconscious, dreaming
if you look into quantum physics you'll see that it's usually understood that there are at least
9 dimensions in nature the 3rd dimension being the physical plane and the astral plane
being commonly known as the 5th dimension and so we're here talking and struggling
to comprehend the 5th dimension but we can't even begin to imagine how to speculate and grasp
about the realities of the 6th, 7th, 8th, 9th dimensions or above that either, if you
listen to my last experience about trying to wake unconscious people up in the astral you'll hear
that i saw my girlfriend unconscious in the astral plane and that when i tried to make her conscious
of herself i started to see a source of dream phantom double of her come from somewhere else
and begin to merge with her, it's my theory that in reality the unconscious astral body of her that i
was with was very unconscious and that her primary awareness was actually lodged and grounded within
another dream world somewhere else at the same time, you know, we are multi-dimensional beings and
in our current state we are also fragmented beings with fragmented consciousness with little bits of
ourselves and our awareness scattered everywhere here and there, you know just think in the physical
we can think multiple thoughts at the same time our minds can be full of noise, beyond layers and
layers, and with that we can be in a physical location but be completely somewhere else in
our heads at the same time and this is really no different than dreaming when we're in the astral
so to give an example think of a child who isn't interested in his classroom at all and instead
goes into fantasies in his mind now he is attending the class but he isn't really there
so in this case the child literally is in 2 worlds at the same time, As Above So Below,
this can happen in the physical and also in the astral, as to which dreams or astral experiences
we remember upon awakening i think that's up to the individual, since posting my astral class
experience i've already had a few people who say they remembered certain dreams of classes, so some
people do remember unconscious astral experiences but i don't think it's as common, what i suspect
and what i understand is that people tend to remember the experiences or the dreams that are
more interesting or fun to them or their ego the ones that really make an impression on their mind
and so when it comes to experiences in the astral the individual may be more subconsciously inclined
not to believe it or not be as interested in such experiences and therefore the subconscious doesn't
have as much power or desire in bringing back the memory to the conscious mind, there's also no
willpower from the individual to remember those experiences, if you are working with dreams and
your experiences at night then of course you have a much bigger chance of recalling such experiences
it's like when children go to school and they simply aren't that interested in the class; at the
end of the child's day they'll probably be more interested in what they did with their friends
than remembering the 'boring' lessons that they had and when the parents ask them what they did during
their outing at school they'll probably tell them the more entertaining things they did with their
friends or in the playground because that's what would have made a stronger impression on
their mind, so i hope for my little conjecture on the complexity of non-physical experiences makes
sense and how they can be truly mind-boggling and go beyond our conventional ideas of how we usually
understand typical dreams and astral projections to be and how the line between dreams and astral
projection can be tremendously blurred, so you know, although this is all very interesting my
advice is to just keep it simple and keep your practice at one step at a time i didn't
come to any of these theories or conclusions by thinking about them or hypothesizing, no, these are
just thoughts that arise instantaneously based on years of patient and practical experience
you may not ever think these specific thoughts that i'm having but i'm sure they are helpful for
your own contemplation and consideration, you know, we are all unique expressions of consciousness
and all hold our own wisdom when you start to awaken your own consciousness
you'll spring forth your own wisdom from your own fountain of understanding which will be different
from mine yet probably have very similar truths much like how there are different traditions
religions and sciences throughout history which all connect to each other in different ways
so thank you for listening please like and subscribe if you enjoyed the video there will
be much more like this on the way and if you'd like me to clarify about absolutely anything
simply just ask a question in the comments below and i will get back to you if you'd like to
support the channel there's a link for the \patreon as well and if you'd like to be notified when i
upload a new video just click the bell button and i'll see you on the next video, thank you
